source_note: State baseline derived from New Jersey DEP mandatory recycling law and municipal solid waste programs.

organics.guidance: Commercial food waste recycling required under NJ Food Waste Recycling Law (P.L.2017, c.136).
organics.notes: Many municipalities offer yard waste collection; food scrap programs expanding.

paper_cardboard.guidance: Recycle clean, dry paper and cardboard; flatten boxes.

glass_containers.guidance: Recycle bottles and jars (rinsed, no lids).
glass_containers.bin: Mixed recycling bin or separate glass container.

metal_containers.guidance: Recycle aluminum and tin cans (clean and empty).
metal_containers.notes: Aerosol cans only if completely empty.

plastics.guidance: Recycle rigid plastics labeled #1â€“#5; check local programs for others.
plastics.notes: Plastic bags and foam not accepted curbside.

beverage_containers_crv.guidance: No statewide deposit/refund system for beverage containers.

household_batteries.guidance: Recycle rechargeable and lead-acid batteries at collection points or HHW sites.
household_batteries.notes: Keep out of trash and recycling bins.

e_waste.guidance: E-waste recycling mandated statewide under NJ Electronic Waste Management Act.
e_waste.notes: Includes TVs, monitors, computers, and printers.

plastic_bags_and_film.guidance: Statewide ban on plastic and paper carryout bags effective 2022.
plastic_bags_and_film.bin: Reusable bags required; film accepted at store drop-offs.
plastic_bags_and_film.notes: Applies to retail and grocery stores.
provenance: NJ Plastic Pollution Reduction Law (P.L.2020, c.117)

bulky_items.guidance: Arrange bulk pickup or drop-off at municipal facility.
